title: Remove Letter experience and present love-letter message inside Gift modal with romantic typography

requirements.summary: Remove the “For You”/Letter experience from the interactive hub so only Gallery and Gift remain, and adjust the layout for two cards.
acceptanceCriteria: The InteractivePage no longer renders the “For You”/Letter icon card.
The InteractivePage layout updates appropriately for two cards (e.g., uses a 2-column layout at md+ instead of a 3-column layout).
The app no longer imports or opens LetterModal from the interactive hub.

file_operations.description: Remove the Letter option from the iconCards list and associated modal state type; drop the LetterModal import/rendering; update the grid from md:grid-cols-3 to md:grid-cols-2 so the hub presents exactly two selectable cards (Gallery and A Gift for You). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Move the love-letter message content into the Gift modal, replacing the current gift text while preserving the roses bouquet visual.
acceptanceCriteria: The Gift modal no longer displays the current rose color meaning paragraphs and the quote block; instead it displays the prior LetterModal message content.
The roses bouquet image remains visible in the Gift modal (the roses experience is preserved).
The Letter modal content is not accessible anywhere in the UI after removing the Letter experience.

file_operations.description: Replace the existing rose color meaning paragraphs and quote block with the prior LetterModal message content, keeping the roses bouquet image visible and retaining the existing gift reveal/loading behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Remove the LetterModal component file so the letter content is not accessible anywhere in the UI after the Letter experience is removed. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply romantic typography and structured, letter-like formatting to the moved message in the Gift modal.
acceptanceCriteria: The moved message in the Gift modal is visually presented in a letter-like structured format (not a single plain paragraph).
The message text uses a romantic-looking typographic treatment (e.g., cursive/serif styling via Tailwind/CSS) that is consistent within the Gift modal.

file_operations.description: Extend Tailwind theme typography options to include a romantic-looking font family (e.g., a serif/cursive-style stack) that can be applied consistently within the Gift modal. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a small set of global utility classes (within existing Tailwind layers) to support letter-like presentation in the Gift modal (e.g., romantic font utility + subtle letter styling like leading/spacing) without modifying any shadcn ui component files. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Restructure the moved message into a letter-style layout (greeting, body, sign-off) and apply the romantic typography utilities/Tailwind classes consistently across the message block while keeping the roses bouquet visual intact. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
